item.title: Class 36 - PI REP++
item.dc:creator: @Christiaan Christiaan
item.description:
@Christiaan wrote:

c:/.RetroScape_Cache/data/" + file + “.dat”
I dont know what your trying to do, but you could change it to:
c:/.RetroScape_Cache/data/****.dat
**** = the name of the file your trying to reach.

item.title: Class 36 - PI REP++

item.description:

I’m useing RetroScape but when I add

abyte0 = FileOperations.ReadFile(“c:/.RetroScape_Cache/data/” + file + “.dat”);

Like this;

public static void method529(byte abyte0[], int fileId) { abyte0 = FileOperations.ReadFile("c:/.RetroScape_Cache/data/" + file + ".dat"); Stream stream = new Stream(abyte0); stream.currentOffset = abyte0.length - 12; int i = stream.readDWord(); int j = stream.readDWord(); int k = stream.readDWord(); int i1 = 0; Stream stream_1 = new Stream(abyte0); stream_1.currentOffset = i1; i1 += i + 4; Stream stream_2 = new Stream(abyte0); stream_2.currentOffset = i1; i1 += j; Stream stream_3 = new Stream(abyte0); stream_3.currentOffset = i1; i1 += k; Stream stream_4 = new Stream(abyte0); stream_4.currentOffset = i1; Class18 class18 = new Class18(stream_4); int k1 = stream_1.readDWord(); int ai[] = new int[500]; int ai1[] = new int[500]; int ai2[] = new int[500]; int ai3[] = new int[500]; for(int l1 = 0; l1 < k1; l1++) {

I always get this error;
